item.title: Symposium: Recent Development: Key Escrow Encryption Policies and Technoligies

Baugh Published: 1996 URL: https://advance-lexis-com.colorado.idm.oclc.org/document/teaserdocument/?pdmfid=1516831&crid=8b6ba342-19bb-468d-ba50-25b58114a8ae&pddocfullpath=%2Fshared%2Fdocument%2Fanalytical-materials%2Furn%3AcontentItem%3A3S3V-6N10-00CT-V0F6-00000-00&pddocid=urn%3AcontentItem%3A3S3V-6N10-00CT-V0F6-00000-00&pdcontentcomponentid=139228&pdteaserkey=h1&pditab=allpods&ecomp=sp79k&earg=sr0&prid=045f1ac9-dc07-4c8a-abad-d37187cd5523 Tags: 1990s Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I Government Policy Key Escrow

item.title: The Metaphor is the Key: Cryptography, The Clipper Chip, and the Constitution
item.description: Authors: A. Michael Froomkin Published: 1996 URL: http://osaka.law.miami.edu/~froomkin/articles/clipper.htm Tags: 1990s Clipper Chip Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I Key Escrow

item.title: The Risks of Key Recovery, Key Escrow, and Trusted Third-Party Encryption
item.description: Authors: H. Abelson, R. Anderson, S. M. Bellovin, J. Benaloh, M. Blaze, W. Diffie, J. Gilmore, P. G. Neumann, R. L. Rivest, J. I. Schiller, B. Schneier Published: 1998 URL: https://www.schneier.com/academic/archives/1997/04/the_risks_of_key_rec.html Tags: 1990s Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I Key Escrow Key Recovery Abstract: A variety of “key recovery,” “key escrow,” and “trusted third-party” encryption requirements have been suggested in recent years by government agencies seeking to conduct covert surveillance within the changing environments brought about by new technologies.
